content: Hi! I am a new rust user and trying to write my first commit to the rust project. I was browsing open issues with the tag E-easy and saw #90698 (https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/90698), which seems to a reasonable problem for beginner like me. I am wondering that if someone can be so kind to give me advice on where to start roughly. :grimacing:

Hello! It looks like that issue has been claimed by another contributor. I recommend following allow with the progress on that issue, to see how it gets fixed. You can learn a lot that way!

Also, if the person assigned hasn't made any progress after a while (one month or more) you can ping the issue again.

In the meantime, keep browsing the issues! :innocent:

Ok cool! I have actually emailed the assignee to ask their progress, potentially we might be able to collaborate on this issue. And yeah I will definitely keep browsing issues, I am sure I will eventually find one problem that I can solve.

Thanks! :crab:

@Chen Zhaoyang said:

And yeah I will definitely keep browsing issues, I am sure I will eventually find one problem that I can solve.

With over 7,000 open issues, there's almost certainly something you can solve!

Pro-tip: the E-easy tag is actually very underused in my opinion; the vast majority of issues have not yet been tagged with any E-{easy,medium,hard} tag. This thread has some more suggestions for things beginner contributors can do. A great starting point can be looking through A-diagnostics issues!
